rounds.response:
I’m heads-up against Player 1 and we’re on the flop with J♠ A♥ against the board K♣ 4♠ 3♣. I have just ace-high: no pair, no draw yet. My hand strength isn’t great against a flop that could have a made king for my opponent. However, I’ve already shown strength by leading the pre-flop betting and my opponent only called rather than raising, which can narrow their potential range. With 200 in the pot and effective stacks of 900 chips, I sense a one-third pot continuation bet can push out weaker hands while keeping costs reasonable. I’ll bet 60 chips.

[Bet 60]

[Bet 220]
